intro: Ecbolium swartzii, commonly known as the African sand mat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Ecbolium swartzii produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
